item.title: Bains de Bruxelles-Ville
item.body:
This swimming pool was built in 1949 by the architect Maurice Van Nieuwenhuyse and inaugurated in 1953. It has a swimming pool with public baths and showers.

Inside, besides ponds, there are administrative premises, changing rooms, a room for gymnastics and a boxing room.

The Baths of the Centre also include public baths and showers for people who do not have this at home.

Infrastructure
- Baths of the Centre 1 swimming pool of 25 x 12,50 m
- 1 training pool of 18 x 12,50 m
- showers
- 1 gymnastics hall of 210 m2
- 1 boxing hall of 300 m2

Opening hours : Swimming pools: from Monday till Friday from 7:30 am till 7:30 pm. Public baths: from Tuesday till Saturday from 9 am till 3 pm. Opening only for schools (on school days): Tuesday from 11 am to 11:20 am, Wednesday from 11:20 am to 11:40 am, Friday from 2 pm to 3 pm.
Closing period : Sundays, closures in 2012: 1 January, 9 April, 1 May, 17 May, 28 May, 21 July, 15 August, 1 November, 11 November and 25 December

item.title: Coupole astronomique de l'ULB
item.body: In the winter in good weather only, from October to March, the dome is open to the general public

item.title: Planetarium of Brussels - The Royal Observatory of Belgium
item.body: What could be more grandiose than the deep night sky with its thousands of sparkling stars? But do you know them? Could your children distinguish the Great Bear, trace the polar star, point to Orion? Would they be able to tell the difference between the planet Venus and a star? Where do comets come from?

item.title: Théâtre de Marionnettes Toone
item.body: The museum contains traditional puppets from the 19th and 20th centuries as well as puppets from Belgium, France and Sicily. It also has posters from the 19th century and a library featuring a collection of volumes on puppets from around the world.

item.title: Théâtre National de la Communauté française
Théatre Royal du Peruchet - Marionnettes
item.body: The Peruchet Theatre is housed in a small 18th century farmhouse that must be the area's last vestige of its rural past. The theatre presents shows for children, while the museum has a collection of several thousand puppets from all over the world.

item.title: Wolf (Le)-La Maison de la Littérature de Jeunesse
item.body:
... Two wolf steps from Brussels’ Grand Place...
A new whimsical place, dedicated to children and all the great names who write for them
 
 
" Le Wolf " offers workshops for families, stories told in various languages in very peculiar juke-box, original illustrations displayed in rotating exhibits , and our Unusual Library when you can enjoy reading however much you want. But "Le Wolf" is also the Wolf Shop, where you can find your own perfect book, and the "Cantine du Chaperon" where you can enjoy our "Witches’ Tea", our "Ogre’s Brunch" or "Grandma’s Belgian Cookies".
 
 
Creative workshops : The making of masks, shadows theater, collages, activities in Dutch, narrated stories, kirigami, theater of objects, cooking activities
 
The storytelling Juke-Box is a little wooden house, within which children can listen to the recorded narration of an album while illustrations are projected on a screen. Our stories can be enjoyed in French, Dutch, English, German, Italian and Japanese.
 
The Wolf Shop, in a forest-like surrounding, offers a wide selection of illustrated books, original illustrations, games and objects made by illustrators, as well as a special selection of colouring books.
 
The " Cantine du Chaperon " offers all day long our chef’s specials, fairy tale-style, from breakfast to afternoon treats, through lunch and brunch. Everything is made in-house, with most of our products coming from organic agriculture.
 
The Unusual Library welcomes readers from all ages to sit down and discover our very special selection of children books. Books are available in various languages.
 
But Le Wolf also offers : children activities during school holidays, workshops for adults with children’s literature professionals, private parties and birthdays.

item.title: Viage
item.body:
Viage is a unique Entertainment Centre in Belgium and serves as the venue for the various activities which take place in our massive 14,500m² complex. The 363 slot machines, 34 gaming tables including a poker room and an exclusive salon privé spread over four floors make Grand Casino Brussels the biggest and most prestigious casino in Belgium. In addition to this, Viage has its own theatre which can hold up to 850 people, several bars suitable for any occasion, and a restaurant that is open until late at night!

Viage offers you an experience not be missed!

item.title: Océade
item.body: This is the capital's water funpark, open all year round, with all the excitement of high-speed slides, the charm of jacuzzis, saunas, solariums and wavepools. Opening hours changes with the seasons; 10 a.m.-9 p.m. WE, school holidays, public holidays; the other days: 10 a.m.-6 p.m.Closed on 1/4 to 30/6: Monday; 1/9 to 31/3: Monday and Tuesday.

item.title: Mini-Europe
item.body: Located at the foot of the Atomium, Mini-Europe is the only park where you can have a whistlestop tour of Europe in a few short hours. A truly unique journey! Enjoy a stroll taking in the typical atmosphere of the most beautiful towns of the old Continent. The incomparable chimes of Big Ben welcome you to the heart of London. The gondolas and mandolins invite you to discover the charms of Venice. Follow the TGV high-speed train from Paris to the other end of France. You can make the models work yourself: the eruption of Vesuvius, the fall of the Berlin Wall, a bull-fight in Seville and many others. All in all, 350 models and sites with an unequalled level of craftsmanship. Visit also the European area, packed with interactive multimedia games and the exhibition "Spirit of Europe"

item.title: Petit Train à Vapeur de Forest
item.body:
(sorry, no english text) Le Petit Train à Vapeur de Forest (PTVF) est probablement le plus petit train touristique de Belgique. Depuis 1984, le PTVF circule sur un parcours long de près d'un kilomètre. De nombreuses locomotives (vapeurs, diesels et électriques) réduits à l'échelle 1/8 sont réalisées en respectant scrupuleusement les caractéristiques des modèles réels. Il est donc possible de prendre place à bord des wagons qui emmènent enfants et adultes pour une jolie ballade dans le très beau parc du Bempt.
 

Période d’ouverture:
D'avril à octobre
 

Horaires:
Les samedis, dimanches et jours fériés de 14h à 18h durant les mois d'avril, mai, juin et septembre.
Uniquement les dimanches et jours fériés durant les mois de juillet et août.
Ouverture dès 10h pour certains événements.

item.title: Théâtre de la Toison d'Or
item.body: (not available) "Sérieusement comique", c'est en ces termes que l'on décrit généralement le caractère du Théâtre de la Toison d’Or (TTO). Voilà 17 ans que le TTO, situé au cœur de Bruxelles dans des Galeries entièrement rénovées, s’est fixé pour objectif de promouvoir la création théâtrale de textes humoristiques, à savoir des comédies et pièces drôles en tous genres : one man/woman show, humour surréaliste, actualité tournée en dérision, sketches thématiques, vaudeville, feuilleton théâtral, conférence, music-hall, comédie musicale… Bref, d’aborder avec sérieux des thèmes légers et de traiter avec légèreté des thèmes sérieux. Aucun doute donc, une soirée au TTO est une soirée placée sous le signe du rire et du plaisir.
item.address: galerie de la Toison d'Or 396 /396 Guldenvliesgalerij

item.title: Théâtre de Poche
item.address: 1A chemin du Gymnase (bois de la Cambre)/Gymnasiumweg (Ter Kamerenbos)

item.title: Théâtre des galeries
item.body: The Théâtre Royal des Galeries was built in 1847 by the architect Jean-Pierre Cluysenaar, at the same time as the magnificent Galeries Royales Saint-Hubert. In 1951, the Theatre was renovated by the architect Paul Bonduelle. René Magritte painted a fresco on the ceiling of the theatre, reminiscent of the very famous Magritte skies. His initial project was for a sky filled with floating bells. This project was not chosen and replaced with clouds to create a world of dreams.

item.title: Mini-Europe
item.body: Located at the foot of the Atomium, Mini-Europe is the only park where you can have a whistle-stop tour of Europe in a few short hours. A truly unique journey! Enjoy a stroll taking in the typical atmosphere of the most beautiful towns of the old Continent. The incomparable chimes of Big Ben welcome you to the heart of London. The gondolas and mandolins invite you to discover the charms of Venice. Follow the TGV high-speed train from Paris to the other end of France. You can make the models work yourself: the eruption of Vesuvius, the fall of the Berlin Wall, a bull-fight in Seville, the take off of the Ariane spaceship and many others. All in all, 350 models and sites with an unequalled level of craftsmanship. Visit also the European area, packed with interactive multimedia games and the exhibition ?Spirit of Europe?.

item.title: Golf Club Anderlecht
item.body:
The Royal Amicale Anderlecht Golf Club is only a couple steps from the European capital city and stretches out in the Pajottenland countryside, as a natural English landscape. The course with its numerous trees, wild plants, shrub, ponds and bunkers never tire the golf players. The golfer requires a good technical control as well as precision in order to play against the strict course design.

As only 18 holes course within Brussels-Capital Region, the Royal Amicale Anderlecht Golf Club has a major trump: its closeness to the city center. The club facilities get a feel as well for beginners as for experienced golfers, as everyone comes across a practice and a course letting them live out their favourite sport. Besides it's ideal location, the club has another major advantage, a covered and lightened 40 spots driving range.

item.title: Brussels a city of sculpture
item.body:
Brussels is known for its many green spaces, and for being one of the top European cities in terms of its parks and gardens. These make up a world unto themselves, comprising man-made and partly wild areas, plus an impressive number of sculptures in every style - from classical to contemporary. A good example is the Royal Park or Brussels Park: despite seeing several revolutions, it has hung on to its sculptures. For although the Sans-Culottes (revolutionary paupers) wrecked the site in the late 18th century, the city quickly set about repairing the damage and commissioning new sculptures, the very ones you can still admire today between the Royal Palace and the Parliament. It's a good starting point to discover works of stone, plaster, wood or marble, which act as custodians of cultural Brussels and can sometimes be found in the most unexpected areas of the city. Among the best-known sculptors are Strebelle, Meunier, Vinçotte and van der Stappen... Even heroes of comic strips can be found in some Brussels sculptures.
 
 
 
Find out more:
http://www.opt.be/informations/promenades_bruxelles__parcours_de_sculptures__espaces_verts_de_bruxelles/fr/AP/42872.html

item.title: Underground Art
item.body: The Brussels underground is a museum in its own right. More than sixty works of art decorate its platforms and corridors. All genres are represented: paintings, sculptures, photos, screen walls, stained glass windows and a range of different materials: from canvas to bronze and from wood to glass and steel. Each station has its own personality, while keeping a sense of unity that is reassuring for the traveller. Highlights include a work by Pol Bury (1976: "Moving Ceiling") and by Paul Delvaux (1978: Our old Brussels trams) in Bourse underground station.

item.title: B-Gallery
item.body:
B-Gallery is an exhibition space in the City of Brussels dedicated to contemporary creative works by young artists. Its objective is to enable several three-week solo exhibitions to be held (assistance with the production, producing invitations, private viewing, promotion, attendants). Each exhibition is covered by a professional photo-reportage.
The artists, who live in Belgium, are selected on the basis of an invitation to submit projects, issued by the City of Brussels Department for Culture. This call for projects, circulated in art schools, specialist magazines and on the Websites of the City of Brussels, is aimed at young visual artists with a career spanning less than 10 years. They have to provide a dossier describing their project conceived for this exhibition venue, taking its specific characteristics into account. These dossiers are then analysed by a panel of professionals, who assess the suitability of the projects for the exhibition venue.
item.address: Galerie Bortier - Rue Saint-Jean 17-19 /Bortier Galerij - Sint-Jan straat 17-19

item.title: Artiscope
item.body:
Established in 1977, Artiscope is located on the ground floor of a typical Belgian, fully renovated, town house in the area of the European Union headquarters.

Every year, the gallery holds five temporary exhibitions and attends two art fairs in Belgium, France or Italy. Artiscope specializes in American and European contemporary art and deals with highly selective, museum quality art works.

Thanks to the Italian origins of Artiscope’s manager Zaira Mis, the gallery has built strong relationships with the protagonists of the most important movements in the Italian art of the last decades: from Arte Povera Boetti, Paolini, Penone, Pistoletto and from Transavanguardia Chia, Clemente, Cucchi, Paladino. Emerging artists like the Spanish Bernardì Roig, the American Ronald Victor Kastelic and the Italian Enrico De Paris are also regularly exhibited.

Artiscope has frequently collaborated with public institutions in organizing important exhibitions of contemporary art in Belgian and foreign museums (Musée d’Art Moderne, Musée d’Ixelles et Musée Horta, Bruxelles, PMMK, Oostende, Museum voor Sierkunst, Gent, Belveder, Prague, Noordbrabants Museum, s'Hertogenbosch…).

Acting as an editor, Artiscope has published many catalogues and art books of major artists (Enzo Cucchi, Mimmo Paladino…). For the last few years Artiscope has been very successful in proposing monumental sculptures for public and private spaces (Mauro Staccioli, Sandro Chia and Mimmo Paladino among others).

item.title: Waldburger
item.body:
Galerie Waldburger is a gallery for young and international art. Galerie Waldburger is based in Brussels and started its activities in November 2009. The origins of the gallery go back a few years, when first exhibitions with young artists were organised in temporary spaces in Switzerland and Berlin.

The gallery is located at Chaussée de Waterloo 4, directly next to the Porte de Hal, and only a few steps from Parvis St. Gilles. The lively and diverse area around Parvis St. Gilles is an enriching environment for a young gallery, the goal of which is to exhibit emerging art.

item.title: Botkamp
item.body: At the beginning of May 2013, Frédéric Nicolay has opened a centre dedicated to gaming and mangas. With over 150 computers, Botkamp is Belgium’s largest online gaming, development and learning centre. It also has a library.

item.title: Botkamp
item.body: At the beginning of May 2013, Frédéric Nicolay has opened a centre dedicated to gaming and mangas. With over 150 computers, Botkamp is Belgium’s largest online gaming, development and learning centre. It also has a library.

item.title: Magic Spell
item.body:
Magic, mystery and sorcery
 
 
Great Adventure Game, the Magic Spell takes place in a natural environment, in the magnificent and unspoiled country side of Brussels. In teams, with friends or with colleagues, you will immerse during at least three hours in a fantastic medieval universe and experience extraordinary vibrations. Do you dare facing the funny and amusing challenges you will be confronted with by our performers? Humor, team work and action in the open air are the ingredients for the success of the Magic Spell. Come and enjoy together the emotion of the Magic Spell!

item.title: Macadam Gallery
item.body:
Formerly situated within the workshop of photographer Damien Gard, the MACADAM GALLERY project has now moved to an all-new space.
 
The project now occupies it's own 160m2 gallery in the heart of the well-known old working-class district of Brussels: the Marolles, just opposite the Place du Jeu de Balle.
 
The MACADAM GALLERY is aimed at supporting, promoting and sponsoring contemporary arts and artists, both Belgian and International, helping artists achieve higher visibility. The MACADAM GALLERY is conceived as more then just an exhibition area. The new space aims to provide artists, members and visitors with a welcoming and stimulating environment in which to confront and share their cultural and artistic thoughts. To this end, the gallery will host a series of lectures, seminars and exchanges about multidisciplinary arts in their actual expression.
 
The MACDAM also hosts the "MAC LIB" space, private library of MACADAM and possibly one of the finest private Art book collection in the country! Members of the MACDAM and costumers of the gallery may freely consult the extraordinary collection of works while enjoying a selection of hot and cold drinks such as tea, great espresso and delicious fruit juices from the in house café.
 
Under the name of MACADAM PROJECT, this new space will also propose a series of socio-cultural events such as festival, concerts and live performances, as well as different kinds of workshops, promoting and supporting different artistic practices and targeting a diverse audience.

item.title: MOT International
item.body:
MOTINTERNATIONAL is a London and Brussels based gallery founded in 2006 by Chris Hammond. It was located in the East-end of London until 2012, when it relocated to its current site in Mayfair.
 
MOTINTERNATIONAL represents established artists including 2012 Turner Prize winner Elizabeth Price, and Max Mara Award recipient Laure Prouvost. The gallery is increasingly international in scope, working with influential artists such as Helmut Middendorf, Ulay, and the estate of the historically significant conceptual artist Dennis Oppenheim.
 
The gallery’s challenging and rigorous programme builds on its history as the independent project space ‘MOT’, founded by MOTINTERNATIONAL Director Chris Hammond.
 
Between 2002 and 2006 MOT became established as one of London’s most interesting and successful young independent project spaces, bringing internationally acclaimed artists to show within a small artist run space in East London. MOT exhibited the work of over 150 artists, including Martin Kippenberger, Rodney Graham, Mike Kelley, Paul McCarthy, Franz West, Lawrence Weiner, Martin Creed, Liam Gillick, Jeff Koons, Louise Lawler, Dennis Oppenheim, Christopher Wool, Stephen Willats, Ben Nicholson, Sarah Lucas, Mark Wallinger, Simon Patterson, Matthew Higgs, Jon Thompson, Jeremy Deller, Rachel Harrison, Runa Islam, Mark Titchner, Omer Fast, Derek Jarman, John Heartfield and Gardar Eide Einarsson.
 
In 2011, on the crest of its popularity, MOTINTERNATIONAL opened a second gallery in Brussels, further expanding their exhibition space and programme.

item.title: Horse Drawn Tours in Brussels
item.body:
Take the chance to see the most famous places in the Belgian capital using the same old-fashion means of transport as people several centuries ago - by hopping on a horse-drawn carriage.
 
The horse-drawn carriage tours are back in town, more precisely on the historic Grand Place. A tour costs €39 and takes 30min. The carriages will be available 7 days a week, 365 days a year.
 
Some of the places which are included in the programme of the carriages are Place Agora, the Royal Galleries, Rue du Marché aux Herbes and, of course, Manneken Pis.
